results.title: Liquid Sun (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Apace Research and Sydney University Television Services
results.brief_description: The production of power alcohol from farm crops, and its uses as motor fuel is causing great interest in Australia. It is a major challenge facing primary producers and could be an economic proposition in many areas

results.title: John Lethbridge
results.creator_credit: Bob Weis, Judi Stack, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
John Lethbridge’s works, his paintings, drawings and sculptural installations develop out of a personal necessity to try to give an order to the rituals and repeating experiences of life that recur in an apparently unordered and random world. His recent work can be described as “Post Conceptual Romanticism”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bob Weis, Judi Stack, Robert Lindsay, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions

results.title: Simple looms. Part 1
results.creator_credit: John Gray and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description: A how-to-do it program intended to provide the viewer with the confidence, skill and interest to try it for themselves. Suggestions are given on how inspiration and ideas may be drawn from the natural world for weaving design themes.

results.title: Half and Half
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “School’s Out”.
Prejudice, language and cultural differences are among the difficulties faced in school by migrant children. After school the problems are more pronounced: they feel halfway between their parents’ culture and the Australian lifestyle

results.title: A Working holiday
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.description: Hop picking in Victoria; seasonal workers gather from all parts of Australia for six weeks to harvest hops in the rich Ovens Valley. Shows the picking, bagging and weighing of the bags, and transport to the kilns. The weekend break is spent swimming, fishing or sight-seeing in the surrounding Alps.

results.title: Wool: fashion's choice for '62
results.creator_credit: Frank Land and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: Models strut the latest wool fashions, using locations around Melbourne as their backdrop. Some of these localities include the banks of the Yarra, Captain Cook’s Cottage, St Kilda Pier, King’s Domain, the Botanical and Exhibition Gardens, and the Myer Music Bowl. Commentated by Roger Climpson, Fashion adviser: Sybil Jackson and photographed by George Heath.
results.description: Models strut the latest wool fashions, using locations around Melbourne as their backdrop. Some of these localities include the banks of the Yarra, Captain Cook’s Cottage, St Kilda Pier, King’s Domain, the Botanical and Exhibition Gardens, and the Myer Music Bowl. Commentated by Roger Climpson, Fashion adviser: Sybil Jackson and photographed by George Heath.

Some of these localities include the banks of the Yarra, Captain Cook’s Cottage, St Kilda Pier, King’s Domain, the Botanical and Exhibition Gardens, and the Myer Music Bowl. Commentated by Roger Climpson, Fashion adviser: Sybil Jackson and photographed by George Heath.

results.title: Wool Fashion Awards 1967
results.brief_description: Models are posed against a variety of Melbourne’s buildings such as Melbourne University, Fitzroy Gardens, National Gallery of Victoria…both interior and exterior backgrounds are used. We see the award winning garments: slack suits, lounging pyjamas, coats and dresses for both day and evening wear.
